# Adding Animated Wallpapers to Your Desktop in Windows 11

- by [Dellenny](https://dellenny.com/author/delenyprogmail-com/)
- November 8, 2025November 8, 2025

![](https://i0.wp.com/dellenny.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Adding-Animated-Wallpapers-to-Your-Desktop-in-Windows-11.jpg?fit=300%2C300&ssl=1)

If you’re running Windows 11 and want to make your desktop feel more alive, animated wallpapers (also called *live wallpapers*) are a great way to do it. Instead of using a static picture, you can add movement, atmosphere, and personality to your workspace. This guide will walk you through everything you need to know—how to add animated wallpapers to Windows 11, what tools you’ll need, how to optimize performance, and useful tips for keeping your desktop stylish and smooth.

## **Why Use Animated Wallpapers on Windows 11?**

A regular desktop background can get boring quickly, especially if you spend hours at your computer. Animated wallpapers provide:

- **A more dynamic visual environment** that reacts or moves subtly in the background.
- **Personal expression**, allowing you to reflect your mood or creativity.
- **Improved atmosphere**—some people find ambient animations relaxing or motivating.

However, it’s important to know that Windows 11 doesn’t currently support animated wallpapers by default. You’ll need a **third-party tool** to enable this feature. Thankfully, there are several excellent apps that make the process simple and safe.

## **Top Tools for Animated Wallpapers in Windows 11**

Here are two of the most popular and reliable tools for setting up live wallpapers:

### **1. Lively Wallpaper (Free)**

Lively Wallpaper is a free, open-source app available through the Microsoft Store. It supports video files, GIFs, web pages, and even YouTube links. You can use it on multiple monitors and fine-tune performance settings. It’s one of the easiest ways to get started with animated wallpapers in Windows 11.

### **2. Wallpaper Engine (Paid)**

Wallpaper Engine is a premium app available on Steam. It offers a massive library of user-created wallpapers—animated, interactive, and even 3D. It’s more advanced than Lively, with customizable effects and motion controls. If you want maximum flexibility and quality, it’s worth the small price.

For most users, starting with Lively Wallpaper is ideal since it’s free and beginner-friendly.

## **Step-by-Step: Adding an Animated Wallpaper Using Lively Wallpaper**

Follow these steps to set up your first animated wallpaper:

1. **Install Lively Wallpaper**
- Open the Microsoft Store on your PC.
- Search for “Lively Wallpaper.”
- Click *Install* and wait for the app to download.
2. **Launch the App**
- Open Lively Wallpaper.
- You’ll see a built-in collection of live wallpapers like “Triangles & Light,” “Periodic Table,” and others.
3. **Choose a Wallpaper from the Library**
- Click on any wallpaper to instantly set it as your desktop background.
4. **Use Your Own Video, GIF, or Web Page**
- To add your own, click the **“+” (plus)** icon in the app.
- Select a video or GIF file from your computer, or paste a web link (like a YouTube video).
- Once added, it will appear in your personal library.
5. **Configure Multi-Monitor Settings**
- If you use multiple monitors, open Lively’s *Display Settings*.
- Choose whether to use different wallpapers per screen, duplicate one, or stretch one across all monitors.
6. **Adjust Performance Settings**
- Animated wallpapers use more GPU and CPU resources than static images.
- In *Settings*, enable features like pausing the wallpaper when running a game, using fullscreen apps, or when on battery power.
7. **Minimize and Enjoy**
- Once your wallpaper is applied, minimize Lively Wallpaper. It will continue running in the background automatically.

## **Performance and Practical Considerations**

While animated wallpapers look great, they can impact your system depending on the content and hardware. Here’s what to keep in mind:

- **Resource Usage**: Video wallpapers use your graphics card and memory. On lower-end PCs, this could cause minor lag.
- **Battery Life**: If you’re on a laptop, moving wallpapers can reduce battery runtime. Set them to pause when unplugged.
- **No Lock Screen Support**: Windows 11 doesn’t allow animated wallpapers on the lock screen—only static images or slideshows.
- **Adjust Quality Settings**: In performance options, lower resolution or frame rate if your computer slows down.
- **Avoid Overly Distracting Wallpapers**: Too much movement can reduce focus. Choose calm or slow animations for work environments.
- **Security**: Only download wallpapers from trusted sources to avoid malware or corrupted files.

## **Tips and Creative Ideas**

Animated wallpapers are all about personal taste and creativity. Try these ideas to make your setup stand out:

- **Use Ambient Motion**: Choose wallpapers with subtle movement, such as flowing water, drifting clouds, or glowing particles.
- **Create Your Own Loops**: Record your own short video or timelapse and use it as a personalized wallpaper.
- **Sync with Your Mood or Season**: Switch between different live wallpapers depending on your mood or time of year.
- **Dual Monitor Design**: Use one animated wallpaper on your main display and a calm static one on your secondary monitor.
- **Productivity-Friendly Choices**: Pick wallpapers that use soft colors and gentle animation to minimize distraction.
- **Automate Changes**: Some apps let you schedule wallpaper changes throughout the day—morning, work hours, and evening.
- **Backup Settings**: Save your favorite wallpapers and settings so you can easily restore them after updates.

## **Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)**

**Q: Does Windows 11 natively support animated wallpapers?** No. You’ll need a third-party app like Lively Wallpaper or Wallpaper Engine.

**Q: Can I use a GIF as a wallpaper?** Yes. Many tools allow direct GIF support, or you can convert GIFs to MP4 and apply them as video wallpapers.

**Q: Can I make the lock screen animated?** Unfortunately, no. The lock screen only supports static images or photo slideshows.

**Q: Will live wallpapers slow down my computer?** If you’re using a high-resolution video wallpaper on an older or low-spec system, you might notice reduced performance. Using lightweight wallpapers or enabling power-saving settings helps minimize this.

**Q: Can I have different wallpapers on multiple monitors?** Yes. Lively Wallpaper allows you to apply unique wallpapers to each screen or span one across all.

Adding animated wallpapers to your Windows 11 desktop is a fun way to customize your workspace, express your style, and make your computer feel fresh and modern. While Windows 11 doesn’t natively support live wallpapers, apps like **Lively Wallpaper** make it easy and free to transform your desktop into a dynamic display.

Just remember to balance performance and aesthetics—especially if you’re using a laptop. With careful settings, animated wallpapers can look great without affecting productivity or speed.

So go ahead, choose a looping video, a mesmerizing animation, or a relaxing ambient motion scene. With just a few clicks, you’ll turn your desktop into something that feels truly alive.
